channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: TMC - Defects - Other FW6 Surface problem, 23rd February
item.description:
Give and take plus temporary footway closure 28 day footway aburt level difference please replace x1 1400x1300x28mm raised concrete with large concrete patch stats required (FW6 Abrupt Level Differences)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 23rd February
item.description:
Looks like a branch may have broken off in the tree and stuck in the canopy , worried it may fall

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 23rd February
item.description:
PERM - Job 43117958....Could you raise a 28D defect for the below job ( Have already spoken to the AHR they do not want a bollard to be re-instated.) Made safe with barriers. Many thanks
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Post or sign leaning slightly (less than 20 degrees) problem, 23rd February
item.description:
Damaged sign post made safe with barriers on a nwd

item.title: Drain cover is making a clicking noise every time someone drives over it, 23rd February

item.title: There is a previous repair by a utility company which is subsiding, This is now as wide as the trench and about 1 m in length, The subsidence is getting worse as the filling compacts. The aggregate was not tamped down sufficiently when the repair was made, 22nd February
item.description:
The trench repair is located on Old Bath Road, opposite Pilford Avenue.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 224, Old Bath Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
